messages.content: SenseVoice-ComfyUI is a custom node for SenseVoice in ComfyUI.

To install SenseVoice-ComfyUI, you need to clone the repository from GitHub into the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory, navigate to the SenseVoice-ComfyUI directory, and then install the required packages using pip install -r requirements.txt.
From where are the weights for SenseVoice-ComfyUI downloaded?
The weights for SenseVoice-ComfyUI are downloaded from modelscope.
What command is used to clone the SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository?
The command used to clone the SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository is git clone https://github.com/AIFSH/SenseVoice-ComfyUI.git.
In which directory should the SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository be cloned?
The SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository should be cloned in the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory.
What should be done after cloning the SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository and navigating to its directory?
After cloning the SenseVoice-ComfyUI repository and navigating to its directory, the required packages should be installed using the command pip install -r requirements.txt.
No, SenseVoice-ComfyUI is not a standalone application. It is a custom node for SenseVoice to be used within the ComfyUI application.
